results.title: Nature's forge
results.brief_description: Examines the ecological effects of the release of excess heat from power plants. Shows research being done to study the effect of heat from nuclear power plants on fish, plants and animals.

results.title: Natural language learning
results.brief_description: A look at the natural language or whole language approach to the learning of language in the early years of school. This approach is based on the assumption that literacy develops naturally through the use of language as a whole, such as learning to read to follow directions, for information, and to find out about the world. This video also deals with assessment and evaluation and is a good memory jogger for teaches and consultants.

results.title: Native land
results.brief_description: The Ku Klux Klan brutally tar and feather three trade union supporters. Sharecroppers demanding a living wage are hunted down and killed by the local sheriff’s deputies. This film vividly re-enacts these and other actual events, and blends them with documentary footage and narration and songs by Paul Robeson into a call for a social revolution. Hurwitz lost possession of the film during the McCarthy trials. Attempts were even made by the US Government to have the original negatives destroyed - but the film survived, returning to circulation in 1974.

results.title: National Youth Theatre
results.creator_credit: John Crome, John Bloom and Melstrum Films
results.brief_description: Young people from 110 different schools in Britain, take part in the annual National Youth Theatre production. Established in 1956, it has formed 85 other youth theatres all over Britain. Its aim is to help young people enjoy the theatre by participating in it and finding out what goes into making a play and its production. Shows rehearsals leading up to a full scale production of “Coriolanus” in the West End theatre. Some lovely footage of London in 1965.

results.title: National Folk Festival. Part 3
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of folk dances performed at the National Folk festival in St Louis. Includes examples of Israelii, Russian, Czechoslovakian, and American square dances, and Ozark ballads, songs of the Pennsylvanian coal minders, Spanish and American songs and “Casey Jones”.

results.title: National Folk Festival. Part 2
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of folk dances performed at the National Folk festival in St Louis. The film includes Polish, English, Croatian, American Indian, Lithuanian, Ukrainian, Texas and Tennessee dances together with African American and Yugoslav songs.

results.title: National Folk Festival. Part 1
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of folk dances performed at the National Folk festival in St Louis, including examples of Western, German and Philippine dances, a New England barn dance and the Scottish Highland Fling.

results.title: Narrapumelap
results.brief_description: Narrapumelap - A woman looks at footage of herself as a young girl exploring a graceful old homestead and reflects on how it captures the magical nature of the place and its profound resonance in her memory.

results.title: Narcotics: the decision (D)
results.creator_credit: Robert W Larsen and United Research and Training Production
results.brief_description: Shows how a teenage girl seeking the adult world turns to cigarettes and liquor. She is then introduced to marijuana, tries heroin, and suddenly is surrounded by a network of smugglers and drug pedlars. Shows how drugs are injected and the excruciating pain addicts suffer when unable to get a “fix”. Please Note This film is not suitable for screening to children under fifteen. It is suggested the film be previewed for suitability to the proposed audience before screening. Warning: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.
